summary: There could be as many as 9.2 million domesticated equines—including horses, burros, and mules—in the United States, and at least 200,000 free-roaming equines on federal and tribal lands. Managing equine populations poses several challenges, including Affording care for them Finding new homes for unwanted equines Protecting equine welfare, including when they are in transit for commercial slaughter Controlling population growth Addressing the potential environmental effects...
title: Animal Welfare: Information on the U.S. Horse Population
